personality.title: Jaen
personality.look: It doesn't take long to guess who this enormous man clad in armor with Empire insignia is. He's too huge, and too confidant. At last, you have met Jaen, the mighty and infamous leader of the Empire forces.
personality.name: "I am Jaen."
personality.job: "You know what I do. You have carried out my instructions without fail. Before you left, I wanted to thank you personally."

node.text: "I know you do not need or wish thanks. I know you feel you have simply done your just duty. I feel you do, however, deserve a reward."
"He points at the chest nearby. It is in there. With my compliments."

"I led the attack here, of course. As my men sacrificed themselves boldly, I magically concealed myself and found you, to make sure Stalker was properly killed. After you depart, my captains will fetch me."
"I wanted to make sure you were rewarded."
"Telling people they must die for you is the essence of leadership."
"I have all manner of magic at my disposal. I can conceal myself here until I am fetched."
"We only just discovered this dock. I have communicated its presence to my men, and they will get me here. With the loss of Stalker and this place, the insurgency is doomed."
"He was a worthy adversary. Life will be less interesting with him dead. Better, but less interesting. Of course, his followers must be disposed of. This insurgency is doomed."
He smiles. "It was a peculiar effort, a strange action. A small rebellion."

"Small, and over. Now, before you are killed, you should leave. Walk to the end of the dock and help yourself to the ship there. And, in the name of the Empire, I thank you. With me on this island, every evil threat will be ended."
Jaen displays the calmness and confidence of the true fanatic. "The Empire is just. The Empire leads us all."
"Nobody who aided Stalker will be allowed to live. That is the order of things."

"It may sound egotistical, but it is true. The Empire forces here are inept and confused. Were I to die in this battle, the rebels would have little trouble outsmarting them again." He grins roguishly. "Fortunately, I'm fine."
